metadata.Title: CVE-2023-22053 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: Client programs). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.42 and prior and 8.0.33 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server and unauthorized read access to a subset of MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 5.9 (Confidentiality and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:H).

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored.

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
mysql-5.7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
